conclusion: Determine which light has the smallest speed in the transparent material by analyzing refraction and refractive index.
The transparent ball has a hollow center with a radius ratio of 1:2.
A beam composed of red, green, and purple light is incident at an angle of 45 degrees.
The refracted green light is just tangent to the inner wall.
The speed of light in a medium is inversely proportional to its refractive index.
Refractive index n is defined by n = c/v, where c is the speed of light in a vacuum and v is the speed of light in the medium.
A higher refractive index means a lower speed of light in the medium.
Green light being tangent to the inner wall suggests it is refracted to a critical angle or nearly so.
The critical angle is the maximum angle of incidence for which light is totally internally reflected.
Since green light is tangent to the inner wall, its refractive index is higher compared to red and purple.
Typically, the refractive index of a material for different colors of light increases in the order red < green < purple.
Purple light generally has the highest refractive index and travels slowest in the transparent material.
The light that travels slowest in this transparent material is the purple light.
Final Answer: C light (purple light) has the smallest speed in this transparent material.
